--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@...> wrote:
> I have found that I don't want interfaces when I work with Ruby or
> Smalltalk: I like the idea that handling methods has nothing to do
> with type.

Having learned my OO skills in Java, the idea of a weakly-typed OO
language (as I understand Smalltalk to be) doesn't make sense.  As in I
don't understand what that would mean, or how it could work at all.  Do
you know of some helpful material, perhaps targeted at "Java developers
wanting perspective", or correct me if I'm mistaken?

Thanks,

-Kevin
